sequence_you_want: Have the sequence you want, We build it for you.
will_help_you: will help you to get what you want
no_candidates: No candidates that meet the Annealing Temperature constraints could be generated. This is generally addressed by adjusting the arm lengths edges to be longer.
sequence_to_cleave: The sequence you want to cleave
find_your_sequence: You may also find your sequence
select_file_seq:
Select a file with your sequence to upload.
(TXT or FASTA format)
please_select_option: Please select the options that will be applied during the design of the ribozyme
here_design_options: Here are the design options that will be applied to the sequence.
bit_more_information: We need a bit more information before submitting the request
by_clicking: By clicking on the "Submit" Button, I confirm that I have read and agreed to the terms of the
your_request: Your request has been submitted. You can wait for the design process to finish, or enter your email and we will send you a link once it is completed.
select_what_part: Select what part of the RNA you will be targeting. No cut-sites (NUH) outside the selected areas will be considered.
select_what_environment:
Select what environment the ribozyme will be tested on.
 If in-vivo, you may specify an organism so that we may 
 test that the ribozyme does not anneal to off-target locations. 
 If the organism is not in the list, you may select other. You will then be prompted for a tax-id that can be found in the 'Blast' site. In the organism text box, you can find all organisms that NCBI has in their data base, then copy the tax-id unto this website.
provide_details:
Provide details of the environment in which the ribozyme will
 be used. This will allow for optimization over a wide range of
 annealing temperatures, and will help the algorithm
 predict better the secondary structure of the ribozyme.
select_cut_sites: Select one or multiple cut-sites for attachment on the target. Please note that a larger number of cut-sites means increased work-load and thus more waiting time. It is recommended that you use GUC and another alternate cut-site, but not more.
choose_catalytic: Choose the catalytic core that will be used to design the ribozyme.
parameters_length_helices: These parameters relate to the length of the various helices on the ribozyme.
promoter_desc: If the checkbox is checked, the T7 promoter will be added to the final DNA. If desired this should be used in vitro.
specificity_desc:
When verifying specificity, we can either find off-target locations where the ribozyme will cleave or it will
 hybridize strongly enough to silence the gene. If you select cleavage-only, non-cleaving sites will not be considered.
new_customer: If you are a new customer, please fill out the
enter_sequences:
Enter sequences 5′to 3′, upper or lower case. Inosine is ‘ i ’, and may not be in the 3′ position:
 5′ggttataccatacciccAGATTTTCTCggaItta3′
mixed_bases_desc:
The sequence may be entered using IUB codes, or with the bases in brackets, or
 both. There is no extra charge for mixed bases in the 3′ position.
 5′GG(AT)aacccwgg(ag)ggNNCCYGA(GCT)ctta3′
phosphorothioate_desc:
the linkages to be phosphorothioated should be noted with an asterisk:
 5′G*G*C*C*GGATTTATGGCGAATTAGATT*T*A*T*G3′
 Or, if the entire oligo is to be phosphorothioate, just note this in the modifications.
modification_desc: Aminolink, Biotin, Phosphate, etc. You only need to note these in the modifications box.
length_desc:
We have successfully made oligos up to 300 bases. There is no additional cost for long oligos, but we can't guarantee any oligos over 100 bases. Careful experiment design goes a long way towards avoiding the effect of failure sequences. For example, oligos are made 3′ to 5′ so if the
 experiment can select for oligos with an intact 5′ end, longer oligos may be used.

      With proper design, if the experiment allows, 100nt oligos may be used unpurified.
purity_desc:
We offer 4 levels of purity: Standard, OPC, PAGE, and HPLC. Standard oligos are low-salt and suitable for most uses. The exception being labeling with T4PNK. For which we recommend resuspending the oligo in water and drying down once before use.

 We recommend HPLC purification for labelled oligos. For dual-labeled oligos, HPLC is required. Please consult our chart.
scale_desc:
Oligos may be ordered at 50 nm, 200 nm, or 1 µm scale. Alternately, arrangements can be made for a specific yield, if, for example you require a specific number of milligrams or OD units of primer.

The scale of synthesis refers to the amount of material on the synthesis column.
close_the_tab: You can now close the tab and wait for the results to be emailed to you. They will be kept for a week after completion.
